title: Fiesta/Salsa font
content:
I'm looking for font options such as Curlz that give a Fiesta/Salsa feeling.

thanks.
author: bokkah

comments.content: salsa as in the dance? or salsa as in the dip?

I could suggest some of Sudtipos

For party-dance salsa  
 [Murga](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826235230/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/39)  
 [Candombe](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826235230/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/1)

For salsa-food-cook  
 [Amorinda](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826235230/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/16)  
 [Chocolate](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826235230/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/3)  
 [Cooked](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826235230/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/96)

best,  
Ale

Ale knows his salsa.

Also: [FF Fontesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826235230/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_fontesque_1/), a more "sophisticated" Curlz.

\> Chocolate

Perhaps too classy to substitute for Curlz, but a nice piece of eye-candy for a jaded fontplayer. Love it.  
; )

Paul, salsa isn't really for dipping.

hhp
hrant, i'm glad even your condiment usage is sociologically correct. \>^p

Sorry dude - if you like to dip, dip away.  
You should see what I do with chocolate.

hhp
Did you just double-dip the dip?

Why don't you try one of my fonts?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826235230im_/http:/typophile.com/files/roberta_4012.jpg)
